author: Curtis Killman Tulsa World
title: Tulsa mayor prioritizes repair of Swan Lake fountain
text: Having grown up in Tulsa, Mayor G.T. Bynum has fond memories of going to Swan Lake in the midtown neighborhood with the same name. Located in the southeast corner of the Swan Lake Historic District, for decades the lake at 1573 Swan Drive featured a large fountain and actual swans. But after years of repairing the structure, which was erected in the 1930s, the city in 2001 declared the fountain unrepairable due to faulty plumbing and shut it down. Not long afterward, backers of the lake launched a fundraising campaign to rebuild the fountain. That effort failed, and the fountain has remained dry ever since. Bynum said this week that the inoperable fountain is symbolic to him. “The fact that that fountain hasn’t worked for a quarter century was a symbol of the city’s inability to fix problems,” Bynum told the Tulsa World during a Wednesday meeting with the paper's Editorial Board. People are also reading… Now closing in on completing his eighth and final year as mayor, Bynum said fixing the Swan Lake fountain is one of his pet projects that he hopes to see completed before he leaves office. “We will have the Swan Lake fountain operating by the end of this year,” Bynum told the Editorial Board. Tulsa Parks Director Anna America said the fountain was left inoperable for the same reasons other city needs aren’t met: The city didn’t have the money and previous administrations didn’t set it as a high enough priority for inclusion in capital improvements packages. America said Bynum made the project a priority for his administration. Funding for $1.7 million of the project was approved by voters in the November 2019 Improve Our Tulsa capital improvements package. Voters approved another $500,000 in funding for the project in the August 2023 Improve Our Tulsa capital improvements package to bring the total budget to $2.2 million. Daris Construction submitted the winning base bid of $1,871,542.50, which includes the installation of a lake aeration system, records show. America said replacing the fencing around the lake is still being considered but may not be necessary. More landscaping may be included once the lake is drained if no unexpected costs are discovered, she said. Construction at the lake began in March and is expected to be complete by the end of October. The new fountain is scheduled to be turned on by Nov. 1, with cleanup work and other miscellaneous activity complete by Thanksgiving, America said. Bynum’s mayoral term expires Dec. 2.

author: @CalcioNapoli24
title: Ngonge saluta Kvaratskhelia: "Mi mancherai molto fratello, so che spaccherai tutto. Ci vediamo presto"
text: Cyrill Ngonge ha salutato sui social Khvicha Kvaratskhelia ormai in procinto di diventare ufficialmente un giocatore del PSG: "Mi mancherai molto fratello! Buona fortuna per la tua nuova avventura, so che spaccherai tutto! Ci vediamo presto".

author: 梁国胜 原春琳
title: 上海推动中小学生每天体育活动2小时并在校内完成
text:
中国青年报客户端讯（中青报·中青网记者 魏其濛）近日，上海市教卫工作党委、上海市教委印发《深化新时代中小学体育工作高质量发展的若干措施》（以下简称《若干措施》），聚焦当前中小学体育工作重点难点，从课程、赛事、场地、师资、保障等9个方面建立深化中小学体育工作高质量发展长效机制。
近年来，上海出台过多个关于中小学体育工作的文件。例如，2023年9月出台的《上海市促进中小学校体育工作高质量发展进一步提升学生体质健康水平行动方案》明确要求，保障学生每天校内外运动时间不少于2小时；2025年2月出台的《上海市中小学体育工作管理办法》，提出要加强课外校外体育锻炼，全面实施学校体育家庭作业制度，鼓励根据学生体质健康实际情况，布置有针对性的家庭作业。
近日发布的《若干措施》进一步要求，学校要全面落实学生每天综合体育活动2小时并基本在校内完成，包括每天70分钟左右的体育课、体育活动课、大课间，另外还有不少于40分钟的体育锻炼活动，每月至少安排半天的“乐动比赛日”等，吸引学生走出教室、走向操场、走入阳光。
关于“每天综合体育活动2小时并基本在校内完成”具体如何落实，在市教委今天举办的新闻通气会上，几位区教育局负责人、校长进行了分享。
黄浦区教育局副局长金羿说，面对中心城区土地资源紧张的挑战，黄浦从时长、空间、质量上破题，在保障体育运动时长上，做到排课时体育课优先，搭配课间大活动，确保学生每日在校体育活动基本达到2小时；同时，学校将碎片空间转化为运动场域，并向外拓展，例如，黄浦外国语小学就把课堂搬到了滨江步道。
杨浦区教育局副局长曾除非表示，针对体育师资不足的问题，杨浦区将举办“非体育学科教师运动技能系列培训班”，挖潜具有体育兴趣爱好的年轻教师和导师，对外邀请区体育部门教练、上体大研究生等进校园实施课后社团服务。
普陀区洵阳路小学校长朱乃楣介绍说，洵阳路小学面积十分有限，近年来，学校“上天入地”创造活动空间。一方面往上拓展运动空间，西校区打造了150平方米的专业级攀岩墙，有4根标准的攀岩赛道，可以满足标准赛事；另一方面，用防空洞打造了1300平方米的地下空间，陆续安装了空气净化系统和监测系统，提升室内空气质量，开辟了旱地冰壶教室、乒乓、垫上运动和击剑等活动空间，“一上一下”就扩大了1500平方米。
《若干措施》图解。上海市教委供图 【责任编辑：梁国胜 原春琳 编辑：何欣】

author: Insider@trinitymirror.com (Peter A Walker)
title: Edinburgh book wholesaler expands warehouse to meet demand
text:
We have more newsletters Show Me No thanks, close See our Privacy Notice Edinburgh-based wholesaler Bookspeed is increasing its warehouse capacity by more than 40% this summer.
The family-owned business has purchased the neighbouring building at its Salamander Yards site, where the company moved to in 2000.
The expansion will increase its warehouse and office space by 12,000 square feet. Following a refurbishment, the new space is expected to be fully operational from spring 2025.
Bookspeed was founded as a next-day books wholesale service almost 40 years ago. Today it supplies thousands of UK retailers with around two million books a year, operating within retail sectors such as gift, culture and heritage, visitor attractions and garden centres.
Customers include Oliver Bonas, Blue Diamond, the Natural History Museum and Fortnum and Mason.
The headquarters expansion is part of a wider strategy to increase the company’s capacity in order to meet demand.
Managing director Lewis Dawson said: “It’s our mission to put more books into the world and a significantly expanded warehouse will help us do that.
“This move opens up opportunities to work with a greater range of retailers and improve our service to our diverse range of fantastic customers.
“We already have a strong reputation for shipping out orders quickly, thanks to our brilliant warehouse team, but this expansion allows us to further modernise our warehouse and introduce more improvements and efficiencies into what we do.”

author: RedacciónRPP
title: Un sismo de magnitud 4.6 remeció la región Pasco esta tarde
text:
De acuerdo con información del
Instituto Geofísico del Perú (IGP), el epicentro del sismo se localizó a 36 kilómetros al sureste de Puerto Bermúdez, provincia de Oxapampa, región Pasco.
Un
 sismo de magnitud 4.6 se registró la tarde de este jueves en la provincia de Oxapampa, región Pasco.
De acuerdo con información del
 Instituto Geofísico del Perú (IGP), el movimiento sísmico se produjo a las 13:59 horas.
La entidad precisó, además, que el epicentro del sismo se localizó a 36 kilómetros al sureste de Puerto Bermúdez y tuvo una profundidad de 124 kilómetros.
El último
 sismo registrado por el IGP fue el ocurrido este miércoles, 7 de agosto, con una magnitud 4.1 en la región Arequipa. El epicentro se ubicó a 19 kilómetros al noroeste de Lomas, en la provincia de Caravelí, y tuvo una profundidad de 65 kilómetros.
Cabe señalar que el Perú se encuentra en la denominada zona del Cinturón de fuego del Pacífico, donde se produce el 80 % de la actividad sísmica mundial.
Mochila de emergencia
Ante la eventualidad de un sismo de gran magnitud el Instituto de Defensa Civil (Indeci) recomienda tener lista una mochila de emergencia con provisiones básicas y una caja de reserva que consiste en una pequeña despensa.
La mochila puede ser personalizada con artículos de acuerdo a los requerimientos de cada familia, como la presencia de bebés, niños pequeños, adultos mayores, personas con discapacidad o con determinadas enfermedades.
Entre los artículos indispensables en una mochila de emergencia se encuentran: gel antibacterial, papel higiénico, toallas de mano y cara, paquete de paños húmedos, linterna y pilas, radio portátil, silbato, botiquín de primeros auxilios, comida enlatada, paquete de galletas de agua, agua embotellada sin gas, chocolate en barra.
Además, una agenda con teléfonos de emergencia, útiles para escribir, manta polar, pantuflas, dinero, bolsas de plástico resistentes, cuchilla multipropósitos, guantes de trabajo, encendedor, cuerda de poliéster, plásticos para piso o techo, cinta adhesiva multiusos, petate y mascarilla.
Te recomendamos
Millones de personas están consumiendo suplementos botánicos tóxicos para el hígado. El doctor Elmer Huerta nos detalla los motivos por los que millones de personas están consumiendo suplementos botánicos tóxicos para el hígado

author: Diego Romero
title: Canada Post workers continue to picket for negotiated settlement | CTV News
text:
Postal workers in Edmonton are holding their picket lines as the Canada Post strike nears its third week.
The strike is expected to continue as the two sides remain "too far apart on critical issues," Labour Minister Steven MacKinnon said on Wednesday.
On Thursday, the Canadian Union of Postal Workers (CUPW) said Canada Post has been laying striking employees off, a move it called a "scare tactic."
The information you need to know, sent directly to you: Download the CTV News App Some employees at Canada Post's mail-processing plant in northwest Edmonton told CTV News Thursday morning they want binding arbitration. However, the CUPW 730 interim president said the union remains steadfast in a negotiated settlement.
"There may or may not be a member who feels that they're frustrated," James Ball told CTV News Edmonton. "Maybe they do want binding arbitration, but I've been entrusted to speak for 55,000 members across the country and 2,700 members in this local and we want a negotiated contract.
"I can understand their frustration. I mean, we've been trying to negotiate a solution to this for over a year. The contract should have been settled six months ago."
CUPW wants salaries brought in line with inflation, an increase in paid medical days, better benefits, and to prevent the company from using private contractors.
With files from Nicole Lampa and The Canadian Press
